snippet: Frank J. Barbaro, the former judge, testified this week that his decision in the trial should be set aside because he believed he had been biased against the defendant, who is white.
abstract: Frank J Barbaro, former Brooklyn judge, testifies that his decision to send Frank Kagan to prison in 1999 Brooklyn murder case should be set aside because he believed he had been biased against the defendant, who is white; shooting victim, Wavell Went, was black.
lead_paragraph: Frank J. Barbaro, the former judge, testified this week that his decision in the trial should be set aside because he believed he had been biased against the defendant, who is white.

headline.main: Ex-Brooklyn Judge Seeks Reversal of His Verdict in 1999 Murder Case
headline.print_headline: Ex-Judge Seeks Reversal Of His Verdict in a Killing
